reviews.review_msg:
Bad slides, decent tests/homeworks, and taught by one of the laziest professors in the CS department.
She's nice, but no feedback was given on a group project that took weeks to complete. Another one of those classes that makes you question what university is even good for. Happy to be done with this one, can't justifiably recommend this professor
Extremely easy class. Just read her slides and you'll get an A.

The course content is actually very interesting and useful. But the lectures were brutal. The assignments were great, and were fair but still challenging questions. There wasn't enough practice questions available for each of the chapters. The only way to material for the course was the lectures.
Just learn the material on your own. Her slides and approaches make it so difficult to understand. Examples are terribly chosen and make concepts more complex than they need to be.

She's nice, but the class unfortunately isn't structured well and gets complicated easily. Studying on your own is a lot easier, tests were pretty hard but not terrible. For such an important class, it's better to have a prof who can teach well and is engaged.

Dr. Evgenia is one of the most compassionate professors I've had at SFU. She genuinely cares about her students' wellbeing beyond just academics. She is very accessible outside of class, her quizzes and exams are very fair, she provides enough materials that prepare you well for exams.
Her lectures aren't the best, but her assignments and exams are extremely fair.
not the best lecturer, but she gives very fair exams. One of the easier 300 level classes.

lectures are garbage and video lectures don't help at all (just her reading off the slides, no explanations). SO BORING THAT I WANTED TO DESTROY MY COMPUTER ATLEAST 3 TIMES / LECTURE. Concepts are too theoretical sometimes and impractical as hell.

HORRIBLE!. This course seriously made me want to drop out of CS and switch to a different major due to three reasons: 1) What we learnt is useless in the industry. Period. 2) She made it 20 times harder to learn the material due to poor explanations and lecture notes. 3) It was so boring I wanted to claw my eyes out.

You would find her reading from slides and her accent makes it difficult to understand her. Further, she comes off as detached and her midterm and final were tougher to score. As compared to other professors in the course, she taught more concepts that weren't required.
She's not the best, but the course is easy so take it if you want.
Avoid like the plague

She cannot teach for the life of her. This was fine because finally I did not feel guilty when skipping her lectures and learning on my own as this course is easy enough to make that very doable. God bless indian youtubers. She cares about the students and responds fast on piazza. Her assignments are more difficult than exams.

Plagiarized lecture content and halfway through the course pretty much had a single TA teaching the class after she got into an accident. She was MIA after that, I don't know why she could not have provided support through zoom/remotely instead of letting TAs handle the course for her.
Arrvindh 2.0

As much as it pains me to give this rating, because I don't think shes a bad teacher, this class has been abysmal since the midway point. Through no fault of her own, she has not been in class. However, this has greatly decreased the quality of the course. Rubrics are unclear, marked materials are not returned, and the TA's do not care. Avoid 354

She has no idea what she's talking about. She leaves the marking to the TA's, who also have no idea what's going on. Rips her slides straight off of free online courses and regurgitates it like a mother bird. Can't answer questions about the material. Assignments are not good practice and take too long. Absolutely atrocious teaching style.

This felt like a throwaway class, the lectures and homework questions are very short. You do learn something here, but it is all disconnected and hard to see the big picture. Exams are exactly like homework questions (which are not marked), whose answers are given out in class before the exams. Overall it feels like she's not trying hard at all.

One of the best profs for CMPT 354. She is very good at explaining concepts, and approachable in office hours. Very understand and caring for students' well being. Tests aren't too difficult if you do practice problems.

Midterm 2 testing materials are the same as final exam, and yet still gives us one final project to do, which not only testing you on database knowledge, but also focused on your programming skills. sorry what class is this again?

I should have listened, and avoided her. Did not do that. I now see that everything written about her is correct. Most if not all of the course material she uses is ripped off a professor in the UK, including her assignments and homework. She barely responds to emails. Barely provides additional practice questions, says no outright when asked.
She's not a prof, she never answer your question directly and the only answer you will get is "read the notes". For the email, she needs 2 months to reply. Cheers
She never replies to emails, doesn't know how to teach, always confuses herself in the middle of the lectures.
The worst professor ever. never ever take with her

AVOID AT ALL COST. this prof does not answer any type of questions in related to the assignment, midterm or finals, in person and on piazza. lectures were basically reading from the slides, which have flaws that were never fixed. the whole experience was just confusing and painful because "it's up to you to figure it out".

I have no idea how she is employed at SFU. Refuses to answer simple questions about midterms and finals. Extremely confusing lectures. Cancelled over a week of class. Discourages discussions on Piazza. From what I can tell from talking to classmates, majority of the class seemed to struggle due to her poor teaching ability. DO NOT take with her.

This prof did not what does this course cover, she won't answer any academic question because she does not understand at all. She does not care about the class so she will find every single excuse to cancel a class and will not show up during exams even final. The TAs are exactly same as her, useless and barely hold office hour.

I cant believe people will give her positive feedback because she has no effect to her lectures. No clear study guideline, no speaking clear in the lecture and confused her students. I dont know how she can get hired by SFU.

Class average was C+. Final was brutal. I felt like I tried so hard to get a C+. Barely explained anything in class. Even explaining makes everything more confused. Didn't properly teach SQL in class and gave advanced queries in Labs. 99% of my work is self-learning. This is the worst course I had ever taken.

Questions on class discussion-board are useless; she considers any sort of discussion on course material cheating. She is incredibly unresponsive to emails/discussion posts; never gave any information regarding midterm/final. Questions in lectures are pointless; she gets extremely defensive and behaves like questions are challenges to her teaching.

All of her lectures are her reading directly from the slides, so you'll be just fine skipping those, except for around once a week when she goes over some practice exercise solutions that are usually posted online. She does not have office hours and is unavailable on the online message boards 1-2 days before an exam or assignment deadline.

She can't explain things well and cancel class multiple times. Because of bad slides and less SQL practice, it was very hard to do the lab (writing queries). I studied this course by reading books and online resources on my own. The instructor and lecture are not very helpful. Avoid her if possible. Also, that comment below is definitely sarcasm...

She can't explain very well, I think half of class can't follow her(she is friendly and willing to help). However, the midterm, final and assignment are not hard. She spend too much time on math rather than SQL. Didn't learn too much, the grade is ok, avoid her if you wanna learn something.
One of the best professors in SFU. Her lectures are crystal clear. Highly recommended. You have to experience this class. No sarcasm.

unorganised lectures, slides are not that helpful. Really bad at explaining concepts and practice solutions. So lazy that she just copy the questions from the midterms and put them in the final. Include materials from 454 and included that in the final and not explaining the materials properly. Avoid her if you can!

Includes all information in lecture slides which really helps to offset the fact that she can't teach well. I had much greater success tuning her out and just reading the notes rather than listening to her struggle to explain concepts. Overall fair assignments/tests with the final being a little harsh.

She's enthusiastic and seems interested in the course material, but she isn't good at explaining the concepts of the course. The "textbook" used for the course is just notes by another professor, and her notes are just the textbook re-copied without any explanation. Better to just read the textbook. Would not recommend taking this course with her.

Disorganized, rushed lectures. Doesn't seem to have any hand in the creation or marking of homework (when I go to her office hours, it seems like she has never even seen the assignment before). Does not explain concepts well at all.

She is not a very good teacher in class: unorganized, not very clear. However, very helpful when you go to her office hours. 477 is more like macm than a cmpt course, it has lots of logic, and only one programming assignment. Compare to other 4 level cmpt courses, this one is less time consuming. But if you are terrible with logic/macm, avoid 477.

If you see her name on the course list, please heavily reconsider. She is absolutely terrible at explaining things in class. If anything, it makes things even more confusing. Lots of mistakes on her part, everything was rushed and unorganized. Probably the worst prof I've ever had in my 4 years at SFU and that's saying quite a bit. So disappointed.

It is the 1st time I want to rate an instructor by zero score. Temporal logic is not easy but this instructor rushed everything. She only explains easy things and avoid the hard part, but she test hard part in quizzes! Lectures more focus on problem solving not concept explanation. If you don't get those concepts, you will get confused very soon.

Provides no clear answers to homework questions and then says tests are easy because she uses the same questions. She plops transparencies and explains the easy stuff, avoiding the hard stuff. Takes no responsibility for grading, does not check the work of markers. Overall a terrible, unclear teacher. Do not take!

This is the easiest fourth year cmpt course. It is a half semester course and covers fewer materials than normal course. She teaches how to do the question in the lecture, which is really helpful for the tests. The course material is not quite useful though.

She does not explain things very clearly, but she is pretty accessible for extra help. Her midterm and final are fair and easy if you attend all lectures and study the assignment solutions (which is only covered in class). HARD OTHERWISE.

lectures are useless. she can't explain things and didn't prepare for lectures and her notes are copy and paste from textbook with many typo. I can't believe how other ppl comment positive in this course. Totally wasting money and time. Strongly avoid. Hard and confused assignments and exams.
She is very helpful via office hours and email.
She's hot. She does her best to explain the stuff. Overall a good teacher. But the has a very thick Russian accent.
good prof. easy A+

If you think 100-level is easy, you should re-think about it when you take this course. She made the lowest level course of MACM become a hardest course in CS. Her English is extremely bad and she couldn't explain any problem raised by the students in class.

Honestly one of the worst teachers I have ever had. Is never prepared for lectures and simply reads the slides out loud, very little explanation. She emailed us 3 classes before the end of the year to inform us she wasn't going to teach us the last topic, and not to come to lecture anymore. No final review at all, although there was lots of time.

RUN THE OTHER DIRECTION!!!! She is an awful professor. She just reads off her power point slides which contain complex and confusing definitions(it's a math class for god's sake, work through the problems!!!). The textbook is just as useless as the professor. She couldn't find a pen when someone asked her to show something and skipped it. TERRIBLE.
explainations given in class were not very helpful. to make things worse she had a TA teach several classes, who was even worse at communicating concepts. Avoid her at all costs.

I emailed her MANY TIMES (during last 5 days) to ask some important questions for the final. she never replied! then we get an email a night before the exam saying that she lost all the emails, & she'll be away for the evening, so she'll answer our questions AFTER the exam! HOW IN THE WORLD ARE WE SUPPOSED TO GET HELP THEN?!?! SO IRRESPONSIBLE!!!!!
Avoid like the plague if you have any regard for your GPA

AVOID HER if you can! She's a terrible prof! Very unorganized, ridiculous marking scheme. Not helpful at all. This course has a lot of material as a first year course and she's so unclear of what exactly she wants us to know. Lectures are a COMPLETE waste of time. One of the worst profs at SFU!

Incomprehensible, most of the stuff doesn't make any sense. Only the easy topics does she manage to explain properly, because they're easy. (LCM, logic...) Everything else is just read off the lecture slides.
Terrible prof. No point going to lecture, you get nothing out of it. Hard to understand and weird marking scheme. One sentence answer = ~20 marks on a midterm.

The material is not that hard, but she's making it quite hard for the students. Her marking is ridiculously unfair. One short answer question is worth 20 points, if you make a mistake, she'll give you 3/20. Her exam questions are very unexpected. She tries her best to help you, but honestly, it doesn't help.

The worst prof i've met ever. I agree with the point that, having her class, your best friend is your text book. She has been making everything harder than they really is. If you can drop from her class, do that as soon as you can! Instead of waisting your time and getting an F, it is even better to lose some money!
The textbook shall be your dearest friend, you can read all the powerpoints better than how she attempts to read them. In my honest opinion, she sounds like a female Dracula.

For the MACM lecture, she simply just read through the powerpoint and did not give further explanation. And also you have to stay very close to her during the lecture cause the strong accent and low voice made it harder to understand sometimes.

I turned in an assignment and received 2/100 on it.  When I submitted it to a second professor for re-grading, he gave me 87/100 and advised me to drop the course because it was known that Evgenia didn't like my supervisor and was clearly taking it out on me.  She was so rude to me in class it was shocking; I've never not gotten along with a prof!

Not very hard. Not too many materials. Easy to follow. She is a very good marker. You can get a high mark as A or A+ even if you did very bad on the Midterm. She is trying her best to give students best marks.
hard assignment, hard exam, always busy, hard to follow during the lecture. Hardest course I ever had so far in sfu.  strongly avoid.

Unlike other professors at SFU, Professor Ternovska genuinely cares about her students and makes sure they fully understand the material.  The course was very difficult and at times a bit too fast paced (due to it being an intersession course) but she was always available for help via email and office hours.  Great prof!
